DataElement.preferredDefinition: Permanent, transmissible changes in the genetic material of an organism. Mutations can range from a single base change to the loss of a significant portion of a chromosome. These occur when DNA is not repaired prior to replication. Mutations in germ cells can be inherited. However, in somatic cells, they are not inherited. Somatic mutations can arise via exposure to chemical mutagens or ionizing radiation. These fixed changes in the genetic material can, in some cases, lead to cancer or other diseases.:An alteration or difference from a norm or standard._A specific sequence of three adjacent bases on a strand of DNA or RNA that provides genetic code information for a particular amino acid.:The particular portion of space occupied by a physical object._Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is an Integer (32-bit two's complement).

Concepts.definition: Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.
An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is an Integer (32-bit two's complement).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
